text: Trump administration's capture of Maduro raises unease about the international legal framework - AP News
fullText: The capture of Nicolás Maduro by U.S. forces has sparked global controversy. President Trump insists the operation was legal, citing an "armed conflict" with Venezuelan drug cartels. The move aligns with Trump's strategy to restore U.S. dominance in the Weste…

text: 6.2 magnitude earthquake detected in Japan, no tsunami warning issued - ABC News
Hyundai plans 30,000 humanoid robots a year for factories by 2028 - Axios
fullText: The company plans to mass-produce Atlas humanoids in Georgia, and put them to work alongside real humans to build cars.

text: "Come get me": Colombian president's war of words with Trump escalates - Axios
fullText: Asked if the U.S. would launch an operation against Colombia, Trump said, "It sounds good to me."

text: Intel launches Core Ultra Series 3 CPUs, made using its long-awaited 18A process - Ars Technica
fullText: New chips launch "this month," targeting high-end ultraportable PCs.

text: Oscar Predictions via Feinberg Forecast: A New Year and a New Landscape - The Hollywood Reporter
fullText: The Hollywood Reporter's Scott Feinberg updates his picks following the Critics Choice Awards and the Palm Springs International Film Festival's Awards Gala, and ahead of the Actor Awards nominations.

text: Ohio police release video of person of interest in killing of dentist and his wife - CBS News
fullText: Investigators believe Spencer and Monique Tepe were fatally shot between 2 a.m. and 5 a.m. last Tuesday in their home located in the Near East Side neighborhood of downtown Columbus.

text: Maxx Crosby addresses Pete Carroll’s firing - NBC Sports
fullText: The Raiders, as expected, fired coach Pete Carroll on Monday.

text: Tony Dokoupil’s ‘CBS Evening News’ Debut Is an Inauspicious Sign of Where CBS News Is Headed - Variety
fullText: Tony Dokoupil tripped up over transitions and bulldozed a health expert over vaccines

text: Asian defense stocks extend rally as Venezuela tensions linger, markets mixed - CNBC
fullText: Investors continued to assess ongoing geopolitical tensions following the U.S.′ attack on Venezuela.

text: Asus finally gives its ROG Zephyrus Duo gaming laptop the true dual screens it deserves - The Verge
fullText: Asus is announcing a new ROG Zephyrus Duo dual-screen gaming laptop at CES 2026, featuring two full-size 16-inch OLEDs. Its Zephyrus G14 and G16 are getting refreshes too.

text: Trump admin freezes child care funds for Colorado and four other states - Axios
fullText: The move hits programs that support child care, job training and basic assistance for thousands of Colorado families.

text: U.S. overhauls childhood vaccine schedule, recommends fewer shots - The Washington Post
fullText: The U.S. no longer broadly recommends vaccines for flu, hepatitis A, rotavirus and meningococcal disease. Health officials say the guidance aligns with that of peer countries.

text: Ahead of 5-year anniversary of Jan. 6, report examines aftermath following Trump's return to office - ABC News

fullText: Delcy Rodriguez appears to be the linchpin in any US strategy that may emerge.

text: What are flu rates in your state? Cases surge in 45 states, breaking records - NBC News
fullText: Doctor visits for flu-like symptoms — fevers, sore throat, extreme fatigue and body aches — have hit the highest level in nearly 30 years, the CDC reported.

text: Jensen Huang Says Nvidia’s New Vera Rubin Chips Are in ‘Full Production’ - WIRED
fullText: The chip giant says Vera Rubin will sharply cut the cost of training and running AI models, strengthening the appeal of its integrated computing platform.

text: Scientists just got some ancient clues about future sea-level rise — and it’s bad news - The Washington Post
fullText: Rock samples collected from the Greenland ice sheet’s Prudhoe Dome show it completely melted in the past 10,000 years — and could vanish again amid climate change.
